title: India's Election Under a Cloud: Is Democracy at Risk?
content:
The upcoming Indian elections are casting a shadow on the country's democratic fabric. With arrests of prominent opposition leaders, including Chief Ministers, on corruption charges, the playing field appears increasingly tilted towards the ruling BJP. 

While India has always been an outlier in its democratic strength for its income level, the current scenario raises serious concerns about the fairness of the elections.  Central agencies under the BJP's control are being used to target opposition leaders, freezing funds and controlling media narratives.  

The fear of potential jail time for losing elections is creating a dangerous precedent, mirroring similar trends in neighboring countries like Bangladesh and Pakistan. This could lead to a situation where incumbents are incentivized to cling to power at all costs, jeopardizing the very foundation of Indian democracy.
author: Shoaib Daniyal
